DataElement.preferredDefinition: The radiation dose delivered to the patient over the length of the image acquisition (DLP) for this exam, expressed in mGy-cm (DLP=CTDIvol * scan length in cm).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The product of the number of computed tomography (CT) scans multiplied by the scan width (i.e., total scan length). This value is an indicator of the integrated radiation dose of a specific CT scan. This is expressed in the SI units milligray x centimeters (mGy x cm)._How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The product of the number of computed tomography (CT) scans multiplied by the scan width (i.e., total scan length). This value is an indicator of the integrated radiation dose of a specific CT scan. This is expressed in the SI units milligray x centimeters (mGy x cm).

Concepts.definition: The product of the number of computed tomography (CT) scans multiplied by the scan width (i.e., total scan length). This value is an indicator of the integrated radiation dose of a specific CT scan. This is expressed in the SI units milligray x centimeters (mGy x cm). DLP is CTDIvol x slice thickness x # of slices.

Property.preferredDefinition: Quantity; how much there is of something that you can measure.

Concepts.definition: How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

This value is an indicator of the integrated radiation dose of a specific CT scan. This is expressed in the SI units milligray x centimeters (mGy x cm).:A number that can have its decimal point in any position.

This value is an indicator of the integrated radiation dose of a specific CT scan. This is expressed in the SI units milligray x centimeters (mGy x cm). A number that can have its decimal point in any position.
